whatIsBiso.title: What is BISO
whatIsBiso.intro: BISO is the student union at BI Norwegian Business School. We represent, include and empower students across all campuses.
whatIsBiso.content:
BISO brings students together through committees and projects that create academic and social activities on campus.

We work in three directions:
• Impact – give students a clear voice in decisions that affect them
• Connected – unite campuses and connect students with industry
• Engaged – build an inclusive, social and rewarding environment

All surplus goes back to student welfare. That means more events, better services and benefits for members.

politics.title: Our politics
politics.intro: BISO is politically independent. We work for our members’ academic, economic, social, psychosocial and health interests.
politics.content: We advance student welfare through constructive collaboration with BI and student democracy. Our priorities include study quality, inclusion and a safe student environment – alongside practical measures for student life (discounts, relevant roles and low‑barrier events).

bylaws.title: Bylaws and statutes
bylaws.intro: Our governance framework ensures clarity, transparency and accountability.
bylaws.content:
BISO has national statutes that apply across all campuses, and local bylaws tailored to each campus organisation. Together they define roles, democratic processes, elections, finance and responsibilities.

If you need guidance on interpretation or access to the latest documents, contact the Operations Unit or your campus leadership.

history.title: Our history
history.intro: From local student initiatives to a national union.
history.content:
BISO’s story is driven by volunteers who wanted stronger student communities and better study life at BI. Over time, local organisations joined forces to form one national student union with shared values and goals.

Today BISO supports thousands of students through activities, representation and services at every campus.

studyQuality.title: Study quality
studyQuality.intro: Continuous improvement of education and learning environment.
studyQuality.content:
We represent student voices in formal committees with BI and bring forward concrete feedback from courses and programmes. Our goals are better teaching quality, relevant learning experiences and a supportive environment on every campus.

You can get involved by sharing input with your campus leadership or joining a committee that works with study quality.

operations.title: Operations Unit
operations.intro: Our national department that supports all campuses.
operations.content:
The Operations Unit helps campus organisations deliver for students by supporting governance, finance, compliance, IT and shared services. It also facilitates national initiatives and ensures good routines across BISO.

The Executive Board (Arbeidsutvalget) works full‑time to set direction and enable local leaderships to succeed.

alumni.title: BISO Alumni
alumni.intro: A growing network for former BISO students and volunteers.
alumni.content: BISO Alumni connects former students and volunteers who want to keep contributing or reconnect with the community. The network shares knowledge, opportunities and experience back to current students.

saih.title: Support SAIH
saih.intro: SAIH promotes academic freedom and education rights globally.
saih.content: BISO supports SAIH because education creates freedom and opportunities. We collaborate on activities that raise awareness and invite students to contribute through donations and events.
